result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony T Hanes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony T Hanes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony T Hanes was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Anthony T Hanes was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Anthony T Hanes was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, prison funds. Balance paid during Extended Supervision. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.  
All nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges waived due to inability to pay.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order; and due to DV conviction under Federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No violent contact with victim.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers Intervention program.
Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes: Serve 75 days as to counts one and four.  STAYED pending review hrg.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation on counts one and four.  
If revoked, to be paid from 25% of prison wages.   Balance paid during Extended Supervision for those counts.  Failure to pay results in civil judgment.  
All nonmandatory court costs, fees, surcharges waived due to inability to pay.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to each other and any other sentence, except concurrent to Waukesha County case 14CM1142.

supervisions.notes: Counts consecutive to each other and any other sentence.  Straight time.  Clurt intends sentence to be served in Wisconsin State Prison with count one.

records.addlTxt: Counts one and four.
Count three.

Defendant Anthony T Hanes in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Anthony T Hanes in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional Statements from Maureen K. Court reviewed and returned documents to the defense.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH with credit for 156 DAYS time served, with good time, with Huber, counts consecutive to each other and any other sentence, except concurrent to Waukesha County case 14CM1142. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation on Counts 1 & 4, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision for those counts, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, counts consecutive to each other and any other sentence, straight time. If revoked court intends sentence to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison with Count 1. Court STAYED sentence and place defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, counts consecutive to each other and any other sentence, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 9 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 75 DAYS (as to Counts 1 & 4) as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*DOC Agent to contact the court 100 DAYS after release to schedule a Probation Review Hearing.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Anthony T Hanes not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing Hearing. Defendant NOT produced for Sentencing Hearing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for Sentencing to branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Recieved & Filed, Sentencing Documents filed by the defense.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Maureen K. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26209413 in court 1x on 5/4/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Maureen K. was approved for 1 appearance on 5/4/15 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Received & Filed, Letter to the court.
Received & Filed, PRO SE: Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss.
Received & Filed, Letter from defendant.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Anthony T Hanes not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
JUDGE KUHNMUENCH FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea Hearing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23.
Witness fee request prepared for Maureen K. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AS AMENDED, COUNTS 3 & 4
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Anthony T Hanes in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Anthony T Hanes in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the State Pursuant to plea negotiations, Court ordered charge amended to Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(b), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony T Hanes in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Anthony T Hanes in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Rudolph Verhoeven. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to trial. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed By Thomas E. Harris 
Notice Of Motion
Motion For Reduction Of Bail
DEFENSE WILL BE REQUESTING A SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND AT THE PRELIMINARY HEARING.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MAUREEN K. OR I.A.C. (10/22/02).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).

Defendant Anthony T Hanes in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Anthony T Hanes in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
